newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico seizes 843 orchid plants bound for Australia.
newsitem.headline: Mexico seizes 843 orchid plants bound for Australia.

text.p: Police seized 843 wild protected orchids that were about to be flown out of the capital's airport to Australia under the guise of being farm-grown flowers, authorities said on Sunday.
There were 40 different species in the orchids haul, with 10 of them endemic to Mexico or considered endangered, the Environment, Natural Resources and Fishing Ministry said in a statement.
Maria Concepcion Ballardo Vazquez, an orchid exporter, was named as the owner of the orchids shipment, the ministry said. Formal charges are pending, it added.
No details were given about when the seizure was made. Orchids grow in the wild across much of Mexico, especially in virgin jungle zones to the south of the country in states such as Chiapas.
